title: Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Wildlife Fund
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds - Written, Group tests, Personal interview. Panel of two - Directors of Operation and HR Opinions: a good mix of standard & few surprising questions. Tested personal awareness, technical abilities, writing abilities, and teamwork.
Interview Questions: Rate yourself on the following parameters (rapid-fire): [don't remember precisely everything, so here's how it survives in my head] - patience (rate yourself out of 10 on how patient are you?) - ability to perform under pressure - technical knowledge relevant to wildlife & habitats - leadership - conflict management

title: Programmer Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at World Wildlife Fund (Bhopal) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions:
We had a written round at the campus recruitment process to start with. We wrote about our experiences and learnings, mostly categorized into strengths, learnings, setbacks, etc., in 5 questions to be completed in an hour.

The next level was a role play with a case situation, where a protected forest area was being intervened with two infrastructure projects- a dam and a national highway. Fourteen finalists, seven characters to play. Local people representatives, judiciary, politicians, an environmental advisory board, etc.

The interview round started with a 15min phone call interview with the concerned department head, while the interviewers observed. A trail of a variety of questions followed for about half an hour or more.

The ability to conceptualize, organize, articulate and deliver hold key in the process.

The whole experience was long, exciting & tiring but at the same time, quite a well spent time.
Interview Questions: How would you grade yourself on the ability to articulate?
